citation.article-title: Pyrodictium, a new genus of submarine disc-shaped sulfur reducing archaebacteria growing optimally at 105C.

p.s: Description of Pyrodictium brockii sp. nov.
Pyrodictium brockii (brock'i.i. M.L. gen. n. named for T.D. Brock for his pioneering work on the extreme thermophiles)
The DNA base composition is about 51 mol% G+C.
The cell envelope contains as dominate component a peridate-Schiff negative or weakly positive protein with a molecular weight of 150,000.
Growth yield is significantly stimulated by 0.2% yeast extract.
No serological cross reaction occurs with antiserum against whole cell of Pyrodictium occltum strain PL-19.
Type strain is DSM 2708, Göttingen, FRG.
